    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT should have been a message sending from browser process to renderer process, but browser process wrongly<span class="line"><!---->ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT should have been a message sending from browser process to renderer process, but browser process wrongly<!----></span><br>handle this message when the render process send to it.<span class="line"><!---->handle this message when the render process send to it.<!----></span><br><br>In the beginning of the function OnAcceptBrokerClient, there is a DCHECK to ensure broker process(browser process) doesn't handle this process, maybe<span class="line"><!---->In the beginning of the function OnAcceptBrokerClient, there is a DCHECK to ensure broker process(browser process) doesn't handle this process, maybe<!----></span><br>we should change it to<span class="line"><!---->we should change it to<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>if(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process)<span class="line"><!---->if(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>void NodeController::OnAcceptBrokerClient(const ports::NodeName& from_node,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeController::OnAcceptBrokerClient(const ports::NodeName&amp; from_node,<!----></span><br>                                          const ports::NodeName& broker_name,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const ports::NodeName&amp; broker_name,<!----></span><br>                                          PlatformHandle broker_channel,<span class="line"><!---->                                          PlatformHandle broker_channel,<!----></span><br>                                          const uint64_t broker_capabilities) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          const uint64_t broker_capabilities) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process);                #################this DCHECK can be trigger browser crash from a compromised renderer process<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process);                #################this DCHECK can be trigger browser crash from a compromised renderer process<!----></span><br><br>  // This node should already have an inviter in bootstrap mode.<span class="line"><!---->  // This node should already have an inviter in bootstrap mode.<!----></span><br>  ports::NodeName inviter_name;<span class="line"><!---->  ports::NodeName inviter_name;<!----></span><br>  scoped_refptr<NodeChannel> inviter;<span class="line"><!---->  scoped_refptr&lt;NodeChannel&gt; inviter;<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(inviter_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(inviter_lock_);<!----></span><br>    inviter_name = inviter_name_;<span class="line"><!---->    inviter_name = inviter_name_;<!----></span><br>    inviter = bootstrap_inviter_channel_;<span class="line"><!---->    inviter = bootstrap_inviter_channel_;<!----></span><br>    bootstrap_inviter_channel_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    bootstrap_inviter_channel_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(inviter_name == from_node);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(inviter_name == from_node);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(inviter);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(inviter);<!----></span><br><br>  base::queue<ports::NodeName> pending_broker_clients;<span class="line"><!---->  base::queue&lt;ports::NodeName&gt; pending_broker_clients;<!----></span><br>  std::unordered_map<ports::NodeName, OutgoingMessageQueue><span class="line"><!---->  std::unordered_map&lt;ports::NodeName, OutgoingMessageQueue&gt;<!----></span><br>      pending_relay_messages;<span class="line"><!---->      pending_relay_messages;<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(broker_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(broker_lock_);<!----></span><br>    broker_name_ = broker_name;<span class="line"><!---->    broker_name_ = broker_name;<!----></span><br>    std::swap(pending_broker_clients, pending_broker_clients_);<span class="line"><!---->    std::swap(pending_broker_clients, pending_broker_clients_);<!----></span><br>    std::swap(pending_relay_messages, pending_relay_messages_);<span class="line"><!---->    std::swap(pending_relay_messages, pending_relay_messages_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(broker_name != ports::kInvalidNodeName);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(broker_name != ports::kInvalidNodeName);<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, please patch chrome through the following patch<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce the issue, please patch chrome through the following patch<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>diff --git         Thanks for the report! I can confirm the patch works as expected, but this is deep enough in the Mojo internals that I'm not clear what the security implications of this DCHECK failure are. Adding some Mojo owners for comment.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! I can confirm the patch works as expected, but this is deep enough in the Mojo internals that I'm not clear what the security implications of this DCHECK failure are. Adding some Mojo owners for comment.<!----></span><br><br>rsesek@, rockot@ - is it plausible that a compromised renderer could send such a message? Are there any security implications to the browser process accepting it?<span class="line"><!---->rsesek@, rockot@ - is it plausible that a compromised renderer could send such a message? Are there any security implications to the browser process accepting it?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1195333#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        It is plausible for a compromised renderer to send such a message. I agree we should not be DCHECKing, and actually we should attempt to kill any process that sends this message to the broker.<span class="line"><!---->It is plausible for a compromised renderer to send such a message. I agree we should not be DCHECKing, and actually we should attempt to kill any process that sends this message to the broker.<!----></span><br><br>I also think it is a real vulnerability. Example scenario:<span class="line"><!---->I also think it is a real vulnerability. Example scenario:<!----></span><br><br>1. Browser launches new renderer for<span class="line"><!---->1. Browser launches new renderer for<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a> and invites it to join.<span class="line"><!----> and invites it to join.<!----></span><br>2. Renderer for<span class="line"><!---->2. Renderer for<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>evil.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://evil.com"><!---->evil.com<!----></a> sends browser ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT, establishing itself as the browser's "broker"<span class="line"><!----> sends browser ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT, establishing itself as the browser's "broker"<!----></span><br>3. Browser receives ACCEPT_INVITATION from<span class="line"><!---->3. Browser receives ACCEPT_INVITATION from<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a>'s renderer<span class="line"><!---->'s renderer<!----></span><br>4. Browser adds<span class="line"><!---->4. Browser adds<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a> to the network by passing it along to its (evil and fake) "broker", thanks to this line of code [1]<span class="line"><!----> to the network by passing it along to its (evil and fake) "broker", thanks to this line of code [1]<!----></span><br><br>Now that code should probably be checking is_broker_process as well, but rejecting on the original unexpected ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT would still be sufficient to prevent this from happening.<span class="line"><!---->Now that code should probably be checking is_broker_process as well, but rejecting on the original unexpected ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT would still be sufficient to prevent this from happening.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          width: 100%;

          padding: 0;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1195333%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D4800" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1195333%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D4800%252526ust%25253D1703412960407024%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw0oDqaaWJm4J-GOacovJDg6%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT should have been a message sending from browser process to renderer process, but browser process wrongly<span class="line"><!---->ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT should have been a message sending from browser process to renderer process, but browser process wrongly<!----></span><br>handle this message when the render process send to it.<span class="line"><!---->handle this message when the render process send to it.<!----></span><br><br>In the beginning of the function OnAcceptBrokerClient, there is a DCHECK to ensure broker process(browser process) doesn't handle this process, maybe<span class="line"><!---->In the beginning of the function OnAcceptBrokerClient, there is a DCHECK to ensure broker process(browser process) doesn't handle this process, maybe<!----></span><br>we should change it to<span class="line"><!---->we should change it to<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>if(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process)<span class="line"><!---->if(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>void NodeController::OnAcceptBrokerClient(const ports::NodeName& from_node,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeController::OnAcceptBrokerClient(const ports::NodeName&amp; from_node,<!----></span><br>                                          const ports::NodeName& broker_name,<span class="line"><!---->                                          PlatformHandle broker_channel,<!----></span><br>                                          const uint64_t broker_capabilities) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          const uint64_t broker_capabilities) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process);                #################this DCHECK can be trigger browser crash from a compromised renderer process<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process);                #################this DCHECK can be trigger browser crash from a compromised renderer process<!----></span><br><br>  // This node should already have an inviter in bootstrap mode.<span {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(inviter_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(inviter_lock_);<!----></span><br>    inviter_name = inviter_name_;<span class="line"><!---->    inviter_name = inviter_name_;<!----></span><br>    inviter = bootstrap_inviter_channel_;<span class="line"><!---->    inviter = bootstrap_inviter_channel_;<!----></span><br>    bootstrap_inviter_channel_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    bootstrap_inviter_channel_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(inviter_name == from_node);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(inviter_name == from_node);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(inviter);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(inviter);<!----></span><br><br> OutgoingMessageQueue><span class="line"><!---->  std::unordered_map&lt;ports::NodeName, OutgoingMessageQueue&gt;<!----></span><br>      pending_relay_messages;<span class="line"><!---->      pending_relay_messages;<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(broker_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock pending_broker_clients_);<span class="line"><!---->    std::swap(pending_broker_clients, pending_broker_clients_);<!----></span><br>    std::swap(pending_relay_messages, pending_relay_messages_);<span ports::kInvalidNodeName);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(broker_name != ports::kInvalidNodeName);<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, please patch chrome through the following patch<span         Thanks for the report! I can confirm the patch works as expected, but this is deep enough in the Mojo internals that I'm not clear what the security implications of this DCHECK failure are. Adding some Mojo owners for comment.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!         It is plausible for a compromised renderer to send such a message. I agree we should not be DCHECKing, and actually we should attempt to kill any process that sends this message to the broker.<span class="line"><!---->It is plausible for a compromised renderer to send such a message. I agree we should not be DCHECKing, and actually we should attempt to kill any process that sends this message to the broker.<!----></span><br><br>I also think it is a real vulnerability. Example scenario:<span class="line"><!---->I also think it is a real vulnerability. Example scenario:<!----></span><br><br>1. Browser launches new renderer for<span class="line"><!---->1. Browser launches new renderer for<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a> and invites it to join.<span class="line"><!----> and invites it to join.<!----></span><br>2. Renderer for<span class="line"><!---->2. Renderer for<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>evil.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://evil.com"><!---->evil.com<!----></a> sends browser ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT, establishing itself as the browser's "broker"<span class="line"><!----> sends browser ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT, establishing itself as the browser's "broker"<!----></span><br>3. Browser receives ACCEPT_INVITATION from<span class="line"><!---->3. Browser adds<span class="line"><!---->4. Browser adds<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a> to the network by passing it along to its (evil and fake) "broker", thanks to this line of code [1]<span class="line"><!----> to the network by passing it along to its (evil and fake) "broker", thanks to this line of code [1]<!----></span><br><br>Now that code should probably be checking is_broker_process as well, but rejecting on the original unexpected ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT would still be sufficient to prevent this from happening.<span class="line"><!---->Now that code should probably be checking is_broker_process as well, but rejecting on the original unexpected ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT would still be sufficient to prevent this from happening.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 5 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 5 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        
          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>
      
    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;

            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT should have been a message sending from browser process to renderer process, but browser process wrongly<span class="line"><!---->ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT should have been a message sending from browser process to renderer process, but browser process wrongly<!----></span><br>handle this message when the render process send to it.<span class="line"><!---->handle this message when the render process send to it.<!----></span><br><br>In the beginning of the function OnAcceptBrokerClient, there is a DCHECK to ensure broker process(browser process) doesn't handle this process, maybe<span class="line"><!---->In the beginning of the function OnAcceptBrokerClient, there is a DCHECK to ensure broker process(browser process) doesn't handle this process, maybe<!----></span><br>we should change it to<span class="line"><!---->we should change it to<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>if(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process)<span class="line"><!---->if(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>void NodeController::OnAcceptBrokerClient(const ports::NodeName& from_node,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeController::OnAcceptBrokerClient(const ports::NodeName&amp; from_node,<!----></span><br>                                          const ports::NodeName& broker_name,<span class="line"><!---->                                          const ports::NodeName&amp; broker_name,<!----></span><br>                                          PlatformHandle broker_channel,<span class="line"><!---->                                          PlatformHandle broker_channel,<!----></span><br>                                          const uint64_t broker_capabilities) {<span class="line"><!---->                                          const uint64_t broker_capabilities) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process);                #################this DCHECK can be trigger browser crash from a compromised renderer process<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(!GetConfiguration().is_broker_process);                #################this DCHECK can be trigger browser crash from a compromised renderer process<!----></span><br><br>  // This node should already have an inviter in bootstrap mode.<span {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(inviter_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(inviter_lock_);<!----></span><br>    inviter_name = inviter_name_;<span class="line"><!---->    inviter_name = inviter_name_;<!----></span><br>    inviter = bootstrap_inviter_channel_;<span class="line"><!---->    inviter = bootstrap_inviter_channel_;<!----></span><br>    bootstrap_inviter_channel_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    bootstrap_inviter_channel_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(inviter_name == from_node);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(inviter_name == from_node);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(inviter);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(inviter);<!----></span><br><br> OutgoingMessageQueue><span class="line"><!---->  std::unordered_map&lt;ports::NodeName, OutgoingMessageQueue&gt;<!----></span><br>      pending_relay_messages;<span class="line"><!---->      pending_relay_messages;<!----></span><br>  {<span class="line"><!---->  {<!----></span><br>    base::AutoLock lock(broker_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->    base::AutoLock lock(broker_lock_);<!----></span><br>    broker_name_ = broker_name;<span class="line"><!---->    broker_name_ = broker_name;<!----></span><br>    std::swap(pending_broker_clients, pending_broker_clients_);<span class="line"><!---->    std::swap(pending_broker_clients, pending_broker_clients_);<!----></span><br>    std::swap(pending_relay_messages, pending_relay_messages_);<span class="line"><!---->    std::swap(pending_relay_messages, pending_relay_messages_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(broker_name != ports::kInvalidNodeName);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(broker_name != ports::kInvalidNodeName);<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, please patch chrome through the following patch<span         Thanks for the report! I can confirm the patch works as expected, but this is deep enough in the Mojo internals that I'm not clear what the security implications of this DCHECK failure are. Adding some Mojo owners for comment.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!         It is plausible for a compromised renderer to send such a message. I agree we should not be DCHECKing, and actually we should attempt to kill any process that sends this message to the broker.<span class="line"><!---->It is plausible for a compromised renderer to send such a message. I agree we should not be DCHECKing, and actually we should attempt to kill any process that sends this message to the broker.<!----></span><br><br>I also think it is a real vulnerability. Example scenario:<span class="line"><!---->I also think it is a real vulnerability. Example scenario:<!----></span><br><br>1. Browser launches new renderer for<span class="line"><!---->1. Browser launches new renderer for<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a> and invites it to join.<span class="line"><!----> and invites it to join.<!----></span><br>2. Renderer for<span class="line"><!---->2. Renderer for<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>evil.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://evil.com"><!---->evil.com<!----></a> sends browser ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT, establishing itself as the browser's "broker"<span class="line"><!----> sends browser ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT, establishing itself as the browser's "broker"<!----></span><br>3. Browser receives ACCEPT_INVITATION from<span class="line"><!---->3. Browser adds<span class="line"><!---->4. Browser adds<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bank.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bank.com"><!---->bank.com<!----></a> to the network by passing it along to its (evil and fake) "broker", thanks to this line of code [1]<span class="line"><!----> to the network by passing it along to its (evil and fake) "broker", thanks to this line of code [1]<!----></span><br><br>Now that code should probably be checking is_broker_process as well, but rejecting on the original unexpected ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT would still be sufficient to prevent this from happening.<span class="line"><!---->Now that code should probably be checking is_broker_process as well, but rejecting on the original unexpected ACCEPT_BROKER_CLIENT would still be sufficient to prevent this from happening.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:mojo/core/node_controller.cc;drc=12b581a3dd36c0023279db86996c041c312edc61;l=856<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 5 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 5 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
